entry.title: i forgot the way back home
entry.summary:
Author: greensparrrow

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,617Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 4

Summary: He couldn’t fathom it. He couldn’t fathom tomorrow, or sitting up, or Batman’s withdraw, or the sinking of the sun, or the second after this one, or this one, or this one. How was it happening, everything still happening, he was not understanding it. Dust got in his eye and he blinked and his face burned and he was going to puke his lungs and his stomach and his heart out, and shred himself out of his skin with his fingernails. He was overcome by this conviction. This conviction that he could not bear anything else, any little thing, everything was or needed to be destroyed and destroying.Clark struggles with his failure.

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,434Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 91

But escape brings them to Wayne Manor, where morning light and lingering hardness promises more explorations in the shadows.

entry.title: In View of the World
entry.summary:
Author: RenaiRin

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,761Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 30

Summary: "I always thought I'd die first." He spoke into the empty, cold room. "But I never thought it'd be like this." That was the only way he could truly describe it. Bruce in a purgatory of his own making. Perhaps he'd died in the fight with the magician. Or maybe he'd broken his neck falling down the stairs of the cave afterwards. Or the universe just thought his suffering of some grand quality of hilarity that they packaged him inside a glass and metal coffin to float around his home for all eternity, and let multitudes of beings beyond his comprehension witness his agony.______ Or, Bruce gets trapped in a time loop where Clark doesn't exist.

entry.title: And you can quote me on that
entry.summary:
Author: maruja35

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 34,439Chapters: 14/14Kudos: 130

Summary: In a deviation from expectations, Clark and Bruce meet for the first time not as Superman and Batman, and not as reporter and billionaire business owner, but as some version of themselves somewhere in the middle of all their respective identities.Clark nods, pushes his glasses back into place, smiles. It's sweet. It's comfortable. Bruce feels a sense of peace — there's no need to rush this. He steals one last kiss, then walks back to his car. He remembers to text Clark later, when he's back at the manor and before patrol, letting him know he made it home safe and wishing him a good night. He sees Clark again, unplanned, unexpected, Saturday night. Or After the Rift, Clark keeps moving. He's a bit lonely, a bit less trusted than he was before, a bit optimistic about a budding new friendship - relationship? He's determined not to mess things up, but he will. Things never work out just right. Meanwhile, Bruce throws caution to the wind and lets someone in for a change. He thinks it's fine, until he makes eye contact with him from across the room and feels the cool knife of betrayal slide between his ribs. It only gets more complicated from there.

entry.title: All I hear are the words that I needed to say
entry.summary:
Author: Speechless_since_1998

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,732Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 123

Summary: “So we'd be using him as a guinea pig? Yeah, no, bad idea.” “I'm just saying he would benefit from…” “Oh, stop it, Clark. You are not his family,” Dick snapped, "I won't torture Bruce for your unhealthy need to always be a hero!” Clark was stunned, as if he couldn't believe Dick, of all people, was speaking to him that way. Dick, who since he was a child had always looked up to Superman as a role model, who had shaped Nightwing as much by the legacy of Batman as Superman. The Kryptonian's gaze hardened, "I love him more than any of you ever have.”   (Bruce has little time left. Clark and Dick cope, or rather, don't cope, with the loss the best way they know how.)

entry.title: And Now It Follows Me Everyday
entry.summary:
Author: theFamousLivingDead

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,835Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 28

Summary: Gotham has a reputation that precedes itself, but these days even her city limits are overrun with chaos. The streets are littered with rumors about a new shape above the skyline. The docks have been taken over by gangs and civilians are forced to keep to a curfew for their own safety. Bruce Wayne is stumped when all his attempts to prevent crime from taking off in Gotham are thwarted by a lightningfast shadow. His worst nightmare comes true -- there is someone else out there, more powerful than he could ever train himself to be, and he's not on his side of history. In which Clark Kent went out to find more about himself and his origins, but the League of Assassins found him first.
